channel.title: Player Updating
channel.description: Sini thread kinda died so I figured id make a new one. Gonna attempt player updating today and I was wondering how it should be done. I talked to a lot of people mostly on r-s and they said to do it locally (and luckily they provided me with a clear explanation :)) But I was also wondering what makes winterlove's player updating so bad compared to... say... Hyperion? Is it just local updating that makes them different? Any info appreciated.

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

asshole_rule:

i suggest java

gml is the optimal programming language for rsps

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:14, topic:507916”]caching the data makes a lot of sense so you don’t have to rebuild it for every cycle, only when the content is changed.[/quote]The biggest performance impact comes from scanning for the nearby entities to update though, so caching isn’t something that necessarily needs to be implemented for a super fast system until the end - especially since actually constructing the packet isn’t that performance heavy.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

caching the data makes a lot of sense so you don’t have to rebuild it for every cycle, only when the content is changed.

I believe Hyperion makes use of caching update flags, but iirc if it was for the entire updating procedure or for when creating the appearance of a player logging in?

Read full topic

[/quote]:([/quote]
and eyeownyew <3

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

More or less the most widely used way is how WinterLove did it, you can as always improve it in ways such as how Blake used a executor service and the countdown latch as a guard for the local list and then running it in multiple threads and only need to use a lock on the local list.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Damn, I never knew there were so many ways of doing entity updating. Thanks everyone, especially jmood and lin.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You have many choices for how you could implement entity updating, you can do it tile based, or loop through the lists and loop again, and loop again like Winterlove. You also have the option of regional updating, I’ve even heard some saying event based where each player would send out updating events and as you can guess things would go on from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

thanks guys

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Lin:

I’d recommend just making a really shitty system that only handles one player to start, so you get an idea of how it works. Then expand the same shitty system to support multiple players. Next, limit the searching of the players you need to add by implementing a region system. Finally, only add/remove players when you walk/run. Implement packet caching when finished and you should have a pretty fast system.

Shut up you pony! <3

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I’d recommend just making a really shitty system that only handles one player to start, so you get an idea of how it works. Then expand the same shitty system to support multiple players. Next, limit the searching of the players you need to add by implementing a region system. Finally, only add/remove players when you walk/run. Implement packet caching when finished and you should have a pretty fast system.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Updating
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

asshole_rule:

i suggest java

me too

Winterlove’s player updating isn’t what makes Winterlove terrible… It’s a combination of a million things. My advice is to attempt it and if you can do it successfully then revise it, there’s no point in trying to create the most efficient method your first try. You’ll lack a bit of knowledge you would’ve otherwise gained if you do it that way.

Read full topic
